Text Layer

Text Layers allow you show text on screen. Anchor Point determines the point from which the text will be layed out as well as the text alignment of the whole block.

Text Layer

  • Enable
  • Anchor Point
  • Text
  • Font Name
  • X Position
  • Y Position
  • Width
  • Height
  • Shadow Info
  • Color
  • Alpha
  • Scale

Usage

Build your interface out of Layer patches. They can recieve taps in combination with the Interaction patch.

Inputs

Enable

When false, the Layer is invisible

Anchor Point

A point within the Layer's container (current Layer Group or Device patch) that you would like to position the layer relative to.

Options for positioning are:

  1. Top Left
  2. Top Center
  3. Top Right
  4. Center Left
  5. Center
  6. Center Right
  7. Bottom Left
  8. Bottom Center
  9. Bottom Right
Text

A string that you would like to display. You can either set this value directly by double-clicking on the patch input, or connect it to a dynamic input that builds the string from other values.

Font Name

The font family with which to render the text. For example HelveticaNeue-Bold

X Position

Number of pixels to the right of the position specified in Anchor Point

Y Position

Number of pixels up from the position specified in Anchor Point

Width

The width in pixels of the box on screen that will contain the text. If a value of 0.0 is passed in, the text will be a single line, as wide as necessary.

Height

The height in pixels of the box on screen that will contain the text. If a value of 0.0 is passed in, the text not be vertically constrained.

Shadow Info

Draw a shadow on the text by configuring a Shadow Info patch connected to this input

Color

A color with which the Image will be tinted before display. You can use this with a pure white image to display the same shape in different colors.

Alpha

A 0-1 value will fade in the layer

Scale

How much to increase or decrease the size of the Text Layer. A value of 0.0 will make it invisible, whereas 2.0 will make it twice the normal size.

Outputs
